work.title: Digital Transformation Manager
work.description: I’m responsible for orchestration of the transformation which includes supervising the progress of initiatives in the implementation, managing action plan execution and ensure coordination, removing blockers and escalate if necessary, reporting program progress to leadership, disseminating transformation and foster culture.
work.descp1: Leading comprehensive transformations by driving initiative teams, ensuring the success of transformation and providing visibility of progress
work.descp2: Planning transformation in alignment with all stakeholders including defining initiatives, deliverables and timeplan
work.descp3: Managing transformation and ensuring successful completion within the specified budget and timeline
work.descp4: Providing coaching to and motivates initiative teams to ensure success
work.descp5: Collaborating with stakeholders to ensure the transformation vision and roadmap are understood, adopted and supported
work.descp6: Creating a culture of continuous improvement within the organization
work.descp7: Appropriately challenges the team’s thinking, asks questions to trigger new ideas and insights, rigorously considers diverse perspectives

work.title: IT Project Analyst (Associate manager)
work.description: Recent 3 years, I have been involved as a delivery lead in EDW re-platforming project from bottom to top including data analytics, business intelligence, operational reporting, data modelling (EDW layer, Conformed layer, Datamart layer) and team management. Accordingly, I have also been working closely with data technology teams such as Project Management Office, Business Analytics, Data Architecture, Data Governance, Analytics and Infrastructure.
work.descp1: Self-service information with business data catalog and user support: Defining and implementing data warehouse standards and best practices, database performance, security and database access by working with other teams upon architectural patterns.
work.descp2: Demand management and planning: Estimating work effort and duration of EDW projects.
work.descp3: Technical implementation of physical data models: Working closely with data architect team in order to meet enterprise architecture and business requirements for data warehousing and data access layer to manage and ensure efficiency of platforms.
work.descp4: Capacity and availability management: Working closely with infrastructure team to manage EDW platforms.
work.descp5: Managing EDW analytics modules: Working with operational data and operational data teams in order to manage EDW sources and working with analytics team to EDW analytics modules.
work.descp6: Overseeing: Supervising the work of the team about EDW modelling and support.
work.descp7: Big data architectures (Spark, Zookeeper, Cloudera, Sqoop, Hue, and Hive, etc.): Using big data environment in order to store operational data sources (ODS) especially for cold data. For example, 10-year credit card transaction on EDW level. Our ODS layer contains only 1-year data. In case of the need of operational reporting, we use Oracle Big Query (SQL) technology to connect EDW Exadata cluster to Cloudera cluster (Not Oracle Big Data appliance) for remaining 9-year operational data access.
